No air bro, just ill fitting coil overs I'm doing a complete overhaul of the running gear so it'll work properly this time

And yes the narrowing is to fit wide rear wheels.

Cleverchap wrote:No air bro, just ill fitting coil overs I'm doing a complete overhaul of the running gear so it'll work properly this time

Nice, I thought you had sold up and emigrated but I frequently get my wires crossed so wasnt sure.

Whats the motor spec your running? You need to do a build thread pal, I need to see it all!!

I did, I moved to NZ back in 2008 but I'm back now for a while (?) and thought I'd get the kombi out of storage and roll it

EJ22 Legacy motor with Subarugears ring and pinion 5 speed Impreza box. I've ditched the 911 IFS and gone back to a beam, the 944 IRS is staying (with some improvements)

Thats enough of hijacking your built thread bro, I'll start one of my own in a while but theres not much to see right now as waiting on bits to arrive.

Got a little bit done yesterday, not much as Im full of man cold and ache like mad! Started on the exhaust...

Started by squashing the ends to match the T4 manifold flange.



Then sliced two 90 degree bends to make a tee...



Sliced...



Then matched them in the vice...



And zipped them all together, havent welded stainless for a couple of years so not my neatest welds, but by the end I was getting some tidy looking runs, happy with these anyway...



Decided where the turbo is going too, no where near the original plan but means I can fit most of the valance which is a major plus!!



Thats all for now!

Awesome mate! Looking great. That type4 is going to be an animal.

Going to be building my Turbo type1 over the next few months. Think I will pull the bus off the road at the end of the season to fit it though.

Keep going bud you are doing a fantastic job.
